Hi Deb.=C2=A0 I'm not trying to make any claims: I'm trying to determine wh=
at the claims are for the Frank's box.=C2=A0 And so I was asking the creato=
r of the Frank's box, and then summarizing.

wrote:

          
          
   =
         

From: Tom <Tom_Ray@deq. state.ms. us>

            
Subject: [EV=
P-ITC] Re: What does it do?

            =C2=A0
            
            

The fact th=
at the operator CAN and DOES make recordings and files of
understandable wo=
rds and phrases shows that we are dealing with an
OBJECTIVE rather than a s=
ubjective phenomenon here. Two things appear
to be going on though. 

First=
 there is an actual voice modulated signal. Different people who
listen to =
it often hear the same thing. The sound is not perfect and is
very noisy, s=
o that would explain others who cannot hear the message.

The second thing =
is that some people can listen to the noise as a
"random field", and with a=
 slightly altered state of mind, this field
will induce latent "mediumship"=
 ability in the operator and he or she
will get a lot more information and =
voice material than another
listener.

            

Note that the content =
random fields have little or nothing in common
with whatever imagery or sou=
nds may be percieved from them. They simply
enhance the user to access psyc=
hic information that, while even not
being a "psychic" allows him to get in=
fo normally innaccessable to
him/her.

If there is any objective percieved =
sound similar to what is heard by
others impressed upon the background nois=
e, it might be due to the
spirit who is speaking being PRESENT. That entity=
 would then be able to
get the message through to the operator Psychicly on=
 another level.
that the words are also in the noise would be a co-incidenc=
e.

            

I work with VISUAL random fields---The imagery, while cle=
ar, is formed
in my mind/eye system , so I cannot photograph it. Some of th=
is EVP
background noise may be working the same way too---formed in the
Min=
d/EAR system. This is only heard by the primary operator and likely
cannot =
be recorded to a file. 

But some random field stuff IS objective--for exam=
ple, using a random
backdrop for ghost photos makes the ghosts easier to, a=
nd more often
appear in a photo. This is equavalent to the EVP that people =
can hear
on the recorded file.

            

I will discuss and explain ra=
ndom field theory itself, later, in its
own posting.

ast as raw

It's a freaking radio! The tuning is swept across the
entire band, AM or

>=
 >> FM, the resulting bits of speech, music, and noise are
used by the enit=
ites

> >> as a raw material to build their voices from. The sweep
can be l=
inear,

> >> random, or manual, and it does not have to cover the
entire br=
oadcast band.

> >> This is one method and device for providing the raw
aud=
io, and if you're

> >> tesitng to see if it's just broadcast fragments, co=
nsider
this-the concept

> >> is the same as EVPmaker, EVPmaker runs on a c=
omputer, the
entities

> >> manipulate that raw audio *inside* the conmpute=
r, and if
you think stray

> >> RF is going to get *inside* the hard drive =
and mix with
the audio file

> >> you have no clue how any technology works=

e messages

y use, you judge it by what comes through
and what it means

> >> to you, y=
ou can't play the sound snipets to a panel of
numbnuts(objective

> >> list=
eners)) and expect to get an unbiased/honest test. No
two people hear

> >>=
 the same, so an "objective listener" is an insult to most
people doing thi=
s

> >> work.

> >> I know, I'm being harsh.
